title: Trump Promotes Bill for Economic Growth Amid Criticism Over Debt Increase

The president wins over sparring factions within his own party to get the bill passed after months of wrangling.
The vote follows a marathon speech from Democratic leader Hakeem Jeffries, who denounced the bill as reckless.
Donald Trump says his sweeping tax cuts will grow the economy. But, critics say the bill will increase national debt.
US president made a series of remarks while touring Florida's Alligator Alcatraz immigration detention centre.

US President Donald Trump earned a significant political victory when US Congress passed his "Big Beautiful Bill." But Trump's signature tax and spending policy isn't popular, even within his own party.
US President Donald Trump cleared the last hurdle to implement a major part of his agenda to reduce government spending and give tax cuts to the wealthy.

title: Russia Recognizes Taliban Government, Aims to Boost Economic Ties
snippets: The foreign minister in Kabul called Moscow's decision "courageous".
Supreme Court lifted group’s ‘terrorist’ designation in April, as Moscow seeks normalisation in bid for regional clout.
The Taliban government said Russia has made a "brave decision" and set an example for others. Moscow said it wants to boost economic cooperation and help Kabul tackle drug-trafficking and terrorism.

Islamic leaders, in power since 2021, announce development after talks with Russian ambassador in Kabul

Afghanistan’s government has said that Russia had become the first country to officially recognise its rule, calling it a “brave decision”.

The Taliban swept back to power in 2021 a
Afghanistan has remained largely isolated since the Taliban seized power nearly four years ago, despite subtle signs of increased cooperation with countries like China and India.
titles: Russia becomes first state to recognise Afghanistan's Taliban government
Russia becomes first country to recognise Afghanistan’s Taliban government
Russia first country to recognize Taliban rule
Taliban praise Russia’s ‘brave decision’ to recognise their rule in Afghanistan

summary: Russia has officially recognized the Taliban government in Afghanistan, marking the first country to do so since the group took power in 2021. This decision, described by Kabul's foreign minister as "courageous," follows the Supreme Court's removal of the group’s ‘terrorist’ designation in April. Moscow aims to enhance economic ties and assist Afghanistan in combating drug trafficking and terrorism. The announcement came after discussions with the Russian ambassador in Kabul, signaling a move towards normalizing relations and increasing Russia's influence in the region.
constructiveness_reason: This story informs and contextualizes usefully, even if the topic is negative. It provides insight into Russia's foreign policy and its implications for the region. It also gives readers a deeper understanding of the geopolitical dynamics at play, which can aid in decision-making or analysis.

title: Putin Prefers Kyiv-Moscow Talks, Excludes U.S.; Trump Mediation Stalls
snippets: Russian president says future talks need to be between Kyiv and Moscow amid signs latter does not want US involvement.
Trump says he made no progress on Ukraine in his call with Putin &n
The Trump-Putin call comes after the U.S. said it would halt some weapons shipments to Ukraine, which continues to fight off invading Russian forces.

Trump, who campaigned on ending the war between Russia and Ukraine, has become less involved in dealmaking between the two countries.

title: North Korean Man Crosses DMZ into South Korea, Possible Defection Investigated
snippets: South Korean authorities plan to investigate the border crossing and did not immediately say whether they view the incident as a defection attempt.

summary: A North Korean man crossed into South Korea through the heavily fortified demilitarized zone (DMZ), an uncommon route for defection due to its heavy security. South Korean authorities are investigating the incident, including considering it as a possible defection attempt. The unarmed man was discovered in the central-west border section and subsequently taken to safety by South Korean troops. The situation is notable as most defections occur via China, not directly across the DMZ.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a specific incident and the broader context of North Korean defections. summary: The Wisconsin State Supreme Court ruled that a law from 1849 does not act as an abortion ban, ensuring abortion access remains in Wisconsin. Meanwhile, the U.S. Supreme Court refused to hear a case regarding a Montana law that demanded notarized parental consent for minors seeking an abortion. Additionally, the Supreme Court is set to review a case concerning whether biological sex or gender identity should determine eligibility for women's sports teams, a decision that could significantly impact transgender rights.
